choices.A: It is available in Group, Professional, Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions only.
choices.B: Cloud Scheduler is now enabled by default for all organizations.
choices.E: Administrators can add or remove the New Meeting Request button on multiple page layouts using the new Cloud Scheduler quick setup method.
choices.C: You can automatically see the New Meeting Request button on all eligible contact, lead, and person account detail pages.
choices.D: Meeting organizers can not use Cloud Scheduler to request meetings with customers, and have customers select preferred times before confirming the meeting.

questions.question_text: Which statements are true about Cloud Scheduler?

discussion.content: This feature was removed after winter 18 release.

questions.question_text: Clients do not have to enable Customizable forecasting before they can ask salesforce to activate Territory Management.

discussion.content:
Outdated question:
Customizable Forecasting was retired in the Summer ’20 release (July 2020).

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000383459&type=1

If your sales team uses Enterprise Territory Management, Collaborative Forecasts, and Lightning Experience, they can forecast by territory. Territory forecasts give your team a snapshot of how expected sales compare between territories. Want to know which territory has the most closed deals this month? Or which territory is lagging in software deals? Use territory forecasts to find out.

Selected Answer: A
I am surprised no one dispute this answer. I tried it on SF and could enable Territory Management without enabling Forecast. So the answer is A.
As a side note, anyone knows how the answers was picked in Examtopics? I sent this question to the web master but have received no response. Very disappointed.

Selected Answer: B
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.faq_leads_what_happens_when.htm&type=5
=>If existing accounts and contacts share the names specified on the leads, you can choose to update the existing accounts and contacts

Why is A also not true? What if the Lead has same name as an existing personal Account or Contact but it is a different individual? Wouldn't Salesforce make a new record with same name but different SAlesforce ID in that case?

comments.content: According to this article, B is the correct option.

questions.question_text: What happens when you convert a Lead and an existing account and contact have the same name as the one specified on the lead?

choices.A: A new account and contact will be created with different Salesforce ID.
choices.B: You can choose to update the existing account and contact.
choices.E: The account and contact will automatically be overwritten

discussion.content: Print a report from the run page of a report using your browser’s print function.

questions.question_text: You can not use the browser's print function to print reports.
